titles.title: International Commerce Enhancement Act
To amend the Arms Export Control Act to update the export licensing requirements under that Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 5/17/2001--Introduced. International Commerce Enhancement Act - Amends the Arms Export Control Act to increase threshold values of major defense equipment or defense articles or related training or other defense services whose transfer or lease to foreign countries would require a presidential certification to Congress. Exempts from specified congressional oversight requirements any such transfers to North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) countries, Japan, Australia, or New Zealand.
